ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Hello
ygData.msgSnippet: It s always good to make yourself available to people posting here for advise; but the suggestion for a newbie to subscribe to a class-specific list is a very
ygData.messageBody:
It's always good to make yourself available to people posting here for
advise; but the suggestion for a newbie to subscribe to a class-specific
list is a very good one.

You often don't know what you don't know - so don't even know what questions
to ask. By "listening in" on others questions a new person can learn things
they never knew to ask about.

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: Whitmore, Lance [mailto:lwhitmore@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 11, 2000 1:53 PM
To: 'EverQuest@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Hello


no real need to.. im only here to assist people that post here..

-----Original Message-----
From: mferrulo@... [mailto:mferrulo@...]
Sent: Wednesday, October 11, 2000 2:32 PM
To: EverQuest@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hello


In a message dated 10/11/00 2:09:11 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
lwhitmore@... writes:

<< Well.. Hello... its wonderful to have people finally posting here.. been
a
few months since i got a message thru here.. Feel free to post.
>>

Welcome to EQ :)

I would suggest however that you also subscribe to egroup list for EQ that
pertains to your particular class. Those lists are generally much more
active and helpful.

Wizaro Wrathcaster
Sol Ro
